section.p:
You must check all measurements and calibrate as needed. Take extra care to calibrate the transformer and the output current:
Transformer output voltage calibration: The characteristics of the output transformer must be compensated to guarantee the 1% output accuracy independent of the load.
Output current calibration: For a correct indication of the load percentage and for the correct detection of an overload situation and the transformer compensation.

section.title: Transformer Output Voltage Calibration
section.p:
The transformer is feedforward controlled. This means that the output on the secondary side of the transformer is calculated based on the actual measured current and compensated based on a stored characteristic of the output transformer. The second regulator is the feedback controlled outer control loop. This control loop is very slow and compensates slow changes (temperature, ageing etc) to guarantee the 1% output voltage tolerance. The transformer output voltage can be configured as follows.
Set the UPS system in ‘standby state’.
Disable the outer control loop via the service port menu System calibration System test function Disable output transformer compensation .Type two characters in: To activate function two type in “02”.
After disabling the outer control loop, the system can be set on. Configure the settings for the transformer output voltage as per the table. If there is only resistive load available the 140% must interpolated or the battery must be applied to help the input. Be sure that the output current is already calibrated, so that the load percentage is displayed correctly:
Setting Description
329 TransformerOut Volt at 20% loadTransformer voltage at 20% of nominal output current
330 TransformerOut Volt at 60% load
331 TransformerOut Volt at 80% load
332 TransformerOut Volt at 100% load
333 TransformerOut Volt at 120% load
334 TransformerOut Volt at 140% loadTo measure this value please add a DC source otherwise it is not possible to support this load.
It is independent if the load is resistive or has also an inductive part. The relevant value to compensate the transformer is the current and therefor the displayed load.
After calibration, restart the system to enable the outer control loop and activate the new settings.

section.title: Outer Control Loop Calibration
section.p:
Schneider Electric does not recommend calibrating the outer control loop. Instead It is preferred to do the transformer calibration very precisely.The following settings are used for the outer control loop. For one phase system the Ph-N voltage x 10 must be entered. For three phase systems the Ph-Ph voltage x 10 must be entered.
Setting Description
398 Calibration OutVoltage L12 / L1-NOutput voltage x 10
399 Calibration OutVoltage L23 / L1-N
400 Calibration OutVoltage L31 / L1-N
Three phase systems have standard values of 2080, 4800 and 6000 with 1:1 transformer. With all different transformers values from 1000 to 7000 (100V to 700V) are possible. The outer control loop is activated 5 seconds after turning on the system to avoid regulation during startup ramp of output voltage. Too low voltages can be set higher if the value in the outer control loop is set a bit higher.

section.title: Charge Current Calibration
section.p:
The UPS system uses two chargers to charge the batteries. These two chargers must be calibrated to work together and share their load. Only one setting is needed:
Setting Description
21 Charger offset100 means no offset
If the charge current measured is higher than the displayed current value the setting must also be lowered. A difference of 10 means approximately 0.7 A.
